channel.title: 'Contains'
channel.description:
Hai, I'm pretty sure all of you know about the 'EqualsIgnoreCase' Thing. Does anyone know how to make it so it 'contains' Because I'm working on an auto responding type thing. So if someone says the word "rules" It opens up the help menu, Or a simple sendmessage.
Example : "Hey Does anyone know how to get to the [b] rules[/b] ?" Since he said "rules" Or another part of that sentence, Because if I do EqualsIgnoreCase, It's only a one word thing, And if i put a whole sentence, I couldn't possibly know what they are going to say, Example, If I say "Hay wut r the roolz?!" When my thing is "Hey What are the rules?". If you guys have an awnser, Please post.
Kthnxbai.

item.title: 'Contains'
item.dc:creator: @_Joshua `Joshua
item.description:
@_Joshua wrote:

Make sure java.lang.string is imported and you can use the Java Method: contains.

something like the following:

String str1 = "hahawutlol";
String str2 = "wut";

if (str1.contains(str2)) {
System.out.println(str2+" was found inside of "+str1);
}

Unfortunatly, the contains method is case sensitive, however, you can avoid this problem with something like:

if (str1.toLowerCase().contains(str2.toLowerCase())) {

Good luck in whatever you are doing.

Read full topic

I’m pretty sure all of you know about the ‘EqualsIgnoreCase’ Thing.

So if someone says the word “rules” It opens up the help menu, Or a simple sendmessage.
